result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1:15 PM Defendant Austin Brian Kaesermann in court.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Austin Brian Kaesermann.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form efiled.  Court does plea colloquy w/defendant. This case DRI as to plea offer on 22CM305/470.

8:30 AM NOT ON THE RECORD  Defendant Austin Brian Kaesermann appeared by phone.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Austin Brian Kaesermann.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Defense has received an offer and discovery. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling conference on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant Austin Brian Kaesermann appeared by phone.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Austin Brian Kaesermann.  Attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery received, Offer has not been extended - Attorney Lloyd is seeking a global offer, Attorney Gabler will work on it
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

AMENDED - with cases 22CM305 & 22CM470
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Larry Lloyd is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 7/1/22.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
Defendants Response to States Discovery Demand
